description: Manages a V2 VM instance resource within FlexibleEngine.

BootIndex.description:
The boot index of the volume. It defaults to 0, which
indicates that it's a system disk. Changing this creates a new server.

DeleteOnTermination.description:
Delete the volume / block device upon
termination of the instance. Defaults to false. Changing this creates a
new server.

DestinationType.description:
The type that gets created. Possible values
are "volume" and "local". Changing this creates a new server.

SourceType.description:
The source type of the device. Must be one of
"blank", "image", "volume", or "snapshot". Changing this creates a new
server.

Uuid.description:
The UUID of
the image, volume, or snapshot. Changing this creates a new server.

VolumeSize.description:
The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Required
in the following combinations: source=image and destination=volume,
source=blank and destination=local, and source=blank and destination=volume.
Changing this creates a new server.

VolumeType.description:
Currently, the value can be `SSD` (ultra-I/O disk type),
`SAS` (high I/O disk type), or `SATA` (common I/O disk type).

AccessNetwork.description:
Specifies if this network should be used for
provisioning access. Accepts true or false. Defaults to false.

FixedIpV4.description:
Specifies a fixed IPv4 address to be used on this
network. Changing this creates a new server.

FixedIpV6.description:
Specifies a fixed IPv6 address to be used on this
network. Changing this creates a new server.

Name.description:
The human-readable
name of the network. Changing this creates a new server.

Port.description:
The port UUID of a
network to attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.

Uuid.description:
The network UUID to
attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.

BuildNearHostIp.description:
An IP Address in CIDR form. The instance
will be placed on a compute node that is in the same subnet.

DifferentHost.description:
A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will
be scheduled on a different host than all other instances.

Group.description:
A UUID of a Server Group. The instance will be placed
into that group.

Query.description:
A conditional query that a compute node must pass in
order to host an instance.

SameHost.description:
A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will be
scheduled on the same host of those specified.

TargetCell.description: The name of a cell to host the instance.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

AdminPass.description:
The administrative password to assign to the server.
Changing this changes the root password on the existing server.

AutoRecovery.description: Configures or deletes automatic recovery of an instance.

AvailabilityZone.description:
The availability zone in which to create
the server. Changing this creates a new server.

ConfigDrive.description:
Whether to use the config_drive feature to
configure the instance. Changing this creates a new server.

FlavorId.description:
The flavor ID of
the desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.

FlavorName.description:
The name of the
desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.

ImageId.description:
The image ID of
the desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.

ImageName.description:
The name of the
desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.

KeyPair.description:
The name of a key pair to put on the server. The key
pair must already be created and associated with the tenant's account.
Changing this creates a new server.

Metadata.description:
Metadata key/value pairs to make available from
within the instance. Changing this updates the existing server metadata.

Name.description: A unique name for the resource.

Region.description:
The region in which to create the server instance. If
omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this
creates a new server.

SecurityGroups.description:
An array of one or more security group names
to associate with the server. Changing this results in adding/removing
security groups from the existing server. *Note*: When attaching the
instance to networks using Ports, place the security groups on the Port
and not the instance.

StopBeforeDestroy.description:
Whether to try stop instance gracefully
before destroying it, thus giving chance for guest OS daemons to stop correctly.
If instance doesn't stop within timeout, it will be destroyed anyway.

UserData.description:
The user data to provide when launching the instance.
Changing this creates a new server.
